Sentencas: BaCe0.7Ti0.1Y0.2O3-delta (BCTY) and BaCe0.8Y0.2O3-delta (BCY) were synthesized by solid-state reaction method at 1300 degrees C for 24 h. It was found that BCY powders decomposed into BaCO3 and CeO2 after exposure in 94% N-2 + 3% CO2 + 3% H2O at 700 degrees C for 10 h, indicating the instability of BCY in the presence Of CO2 and H2O. On the contrary, BCTY powders remained unchanged under the same conditions, showing the improved chemical stability against CO2 and H2O. Thermal expansion test revealed that BCFY and BCY showed similar thermal expansion behavior from room temperature to 1000 degrees C.
Titulo: Stable BaCe0.7Ti0.1Y0.2O3-δ proton conductor for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The conductivity of BCTY could reach as high as 0.0062 S/cm at 700 degrees C in humid hydrogen, close to 0.0083 S/cm for BCY.
Titulo: Stable BaCe0.7Ti0.1Y0.2O3-δ proton conductor for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with 20-mu m thick BCTY electrolyte membrane was prepared with suspension spray and subsequently tested with Nd0.7Sr0.3MnO3-delta as cathode.
Titulo: Stable BaCe0.7Ti0.1Y0.2O3-δ proton conductor for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The maximum output and open circuit voltage exhibited 295 mW/cm(2) and 0.95 V with hydrogen as fuel at 700 degrees C, respectively.
Titulo: Stable BaCe0.7Ti0.1Y0.2O3-δ proton conductor for solid oxide fuel cells
